resources.title: Prime the Database Design
resources.name: prime_the_database_design
resources.description: Guidance on preparing a clean and well-structured database design before generating your application. These recommendations help Dropinbase produce a clean and predictable outcome.

resources.title: Configure Database Connections
resources.name: configure_database_connections
resources.description: Learn how to configure the connections Dropinbase uses to read and interact with your database.

resources.title: Use the App Wizard
resources.name: use_the_app_wizard
resources.description: An overview of how to use the App Wizard to generate applications from your database design.

resources.title: Delete and Rebuild My App
resources.name: delete_and_rebuild_my_app
resources.description: A complete rebuild option for when substantial design changes are needed or when you simply want to start fresh. Helpful if major redesigns occur or unexpected interruptions happen during generation.

resources.title: Applying Subsequent Database Changes
resources.name: applying_subsequent_database_changes
resources.description: Dropinbase detects when new tables or fields are added to the database and when obsolete ones are removed. Learn how to apply these differences to your generated application.

resources.title: Basic Steps after Importing Tables
resources.name: basic_steps_after_importing_tables
resources.description: Recommended next steps after importing tables, including structuring forms, views, and workflows for your newly generated application.

resources.title: Technical Look at Creating Applications
resources.name: technical_look_at_creating_applications
resources.description: A deeper technical explanation of how Dropinbase interprets database structure and converts it into a functioning application.
